storyline.title: Edward Snowden
storyline.summary: Edward Snowden went on the run earlier this year, taking with him vast amounts of secret information belonging to the US government's security services.

pages.title: London
pages.summary: A former CIA technical worker has been identified by the UK's Guardian newspaper as the source of leaks about US surveillance programmes.

pages.title: Glenn Greenwald
pages.summary: Guardian journalist Glenn Greenwald reports the US National Security Agency (NSA) is collecting the telephone records of millions of Verizon customers under a top secret court order granting the government unlimited authority to obtain communications data for a three-month period.

pages.title: Hong Kong
pages.summary: Edward Snowden named and in Hong Kong.

pages.title: Hong Kong - Mira Hotel
pages.summary: 9 June: Edward Snowden, 29, is named as the source of the intelligence leaks. Speaking from Hong Kong, he explains why he went public.

pages.title: US spy leaker Edward Snowden missing in Hong Kong
pages.summary: The man who has revealed he is the source of leaks about the massive American surveillance programme has gone missing. It is believed Edward Snowden is still in Hong Kong, although he has left the hotel where he was staying. If the former CIA employee is extradited and prosecuted he could face decades in jail. A petition posted by supporters on the White House website, hailing him a "national hero" and calling for his immediate pardon, is gathering thousands of signatures.

quote.quote: I have some information in the intelligence community, and it won't be a waste of your time.

pages.title: NSA leaks: US seeks Snowden extradition from Hong Kong
pages.summary: The White House has contacted Hong Kong for the extradition of US intelligence fugitive Edward Snowden, who leaked details of secret surveillance. The Obama administration confirmed to the BBC that it had asked for his transfer under an agreement between the US and the Chinese territory. 7A senior administration official was quoted as saying failure to act soon could "complicate relations"

pages.title: Moscow
pages.summary: US whistleblower Edward Snowden 'in transit area' at Moscow airport

pages.title: Snowden leaves airport
pages.summary: US intelligence leaker Edward Snowden has left the Moscow airport where he had been staying since June after being granted temporary asylum. Mr Snowden's lawyer said he had left after receiving the papers he needed to enter Russian territory from Sheremetyevo Airport's transit zone.
